Description: Wall fragment of East Greek pottery cup or bowl; interior: glazed brownish-red; exterior mostly streakily glazed; reserved area at one edge, probably the bottom; inscription incised on interior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Edgar incorrectly identifies the sherd as Chian.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (pl. IV, no. 13)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 696, no. 535)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.198)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
